arabicText: الٓر ۚ تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَقُرْءَانٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Alif-Lam-Ra*;	these	are	verses	of	the	Book	
and	the	bright	Qur’an.	(*Alphabets of the 
Arabic language; Allah and to whomever 
He reveals, know their precise meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Alif-Lam-Ra*;	Yeh	āayateñ	 haiñ	Kitāb	aur	
Raushan	 Qur'ān	 ki.	 (*Arabi zabān ke
Huroof jinke Ma’āni Allah aur Jis par Allah 
Ta’āla ne Inko Nazil Farmaya Wahi Janta 
hai.

arabicText: رُّبَمَا يَوَدُّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ مُسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
The	disbelievers	will	ardently	wish	 that	if	
only	they	had	been	Muslims!	(At the time of 
death / in their graves / on the Day of 
Resurrection.)The	disbelievers	will	ardently	wish	 that	if	
only	they	had	been	Muslims!	(At the time of 
death / in their graves / on the Day of 
Resurrection.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bahut	 āarzueiñ kareñ	 ge	 kāfir	 kāsh	
Musalmān	hote!	(Maut	k	waqt /	apni	qabro	
meiñ	/	Qayāmat	k	Din)

arabicText: ذَرْهُمْ يَأْكُلُوا۟ وَيَتَمَتَّعُوا۟ وَيُلْهِهِمُ ٱلْأَمَلُ ۖ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Leave	 them	 to	 eat	 and	 enjoy,	 and	 for	
aspiration	to	involve	them	in	play	- so	they	
will	shortly	come	to	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unheñ	 chodo	 ke	 khāyeñ	 aur	 barteñ	 aur	
ummid	 unheñ	 khel	 meiñ	 dāle,	 to	 ab	 jānā	
(Janna)	chāhte	haiñ

arabicText: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا وَلَهَا كِتَابٌۭ مَّعْلُومٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	every	dwelling	that	We	destroyed,	had	
a	known	decree	for	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	basti	Ham	ne	halāk	ki	us	kā	ek	jānā	
huā	nawishta	(Likha	huwa	Faisla)		thā

arabicText: مَّا تَسْبِقُ مِنْ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلَهَا وَمَا يَسْتَـْٔخِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
No	 group	 may	 advance	 its	 appointed	
promise	nor	postpone	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Koi	giroh	na	apne	w’ade	se	āage	na	badhe	
na	peechhe		hate.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِى نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلذِّكْرُ إِنَّكَ لَمَجْنُونٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	said, “O	you	upon	whom	the	Qur’an	
has	been	sent,	you	are	indeed	insane.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	bole	ke	aey	woh	jin	par	Qur'ān	utrā	beshak		tum	majnoon	ho

arabicText: لَّوْ مَا تَأْتِينَا بِٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Why	do	you	not	bring	angels	to	us,	if	you	
are	truthful?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Hamāre	pās	firishte	kyuñ		nahiñ	lāte	agar	tum	sachche	ho

arabicText: مَا نُنَزِّلُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَمَا كَانُوٓا۟ إِذًۭا مُّنظَرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	 do	 not	 send	 down	 angels	 without	
reason,	 and	 if	 the	 angels	 descend	 they	
would	not	get	any	respite!
romanUrduTranslationText: Ham	Firishte	bekār	nahiñ	utārte	aur	woh	utreñ	to	unheñ	mohlat	na	mile

arabicText: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا ٱلذِّكْرَ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ لَحَـٰفِظُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	We	have	sent	down	the	Qur’an,	and	indeed	We	Ourselves	surely	are	its	Guardians.	( This 
is one of the miracles of the Qur’an - no one has been able to change even one letter of its text, 
despite every effort. It has remained in its original form since the 6th Century (A.D) and will 
remain so forever. Other Holy Books such as the Torah and the Bible have lost their originality.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		ham	ne	utārā	hai	yeh	Qur’ān	aur	be-shak		ham	khud	is	ke	nigehbān	haiñ

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ فِى شِيَعِ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	indeed	We	sent	Noble	Messengers	before	you,	to	the	former	nations.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak		hamne	tum	se	pahle		agli	ummatoñ	mein	Rasool bheje.

arabicText: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	never	does	a	Noble	Messenger	come	to	them,	but	they	mock	at	him.
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	ke	pās	koi	Rasool	nahiñ	āatā		magar	us	se	hañsi	karte	haiñ

arabicText: كَذَٰلِكَ نَسْلُكُهُۥ فِى قُلُوبِ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
englishTranslationText: This	is	how	We	make	the	mocking	*	enter	the	hearts	of	the	guilty.	(*	The	acts	of	disbelief.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Aise hi	ham	us	hañsi	ko	un	mujrimoñ	ke	diloñ	meiñ	rāh	dete	haiñ

arabicText: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ ۖ وَقَدْ خَلَتْ سُنَّةُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText: They	do	not	believe	in	him,	and the	tradition	of	earlier	nations	has	passed.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	is	par	imān	nahiñ	lāte	aur	agloñ	ki	rāh	pad	chuki	hai

arabicText: وَلَوْ فَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَابًۭا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَظَلُّوا۟ فِيهِ يَعْرُجُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	if	We	open	for	them	a	gate	in	the	heavens,	to	ascend	it	through	the	day
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	agar	ham	un	ke	liye	āasmān	meiñ	koi	darwaza	khol	deñ	ke	din	ko	us	meiñ	chadhte

arabicText: لَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّمَا سُكِّرَتْ أَبْصَـٰرُنَا بَلْ نَحْنُ قَوْمٌۭ مَّسْحُورُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Even	then	they	would	say,	“Our	sights	have	been	hypnotised	- in	fact,	a	magic	spell	has	been	cast	
upon	us.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Jab	bhi	yahi	kahte		ke	Hamāri	nigāh	bāndh	di	gayi		hai	balke	ham	par	jādoo	huā

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ جَعَلْنَا فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ بُرُوجًۭا وَزَيَّنَّـٰهَا لِلنَّـٰظِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	created	towers	in	the	skies,	
and	beautified	it	for	the	beholders.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 be-shak Ham	 ne	 āasmān meiñ	 burj	
banāye	 aur	 usey dekhne	 wāloñ	 ke	 liye	
āarāsta	kiyā

arabicText: وَحَفِظْنَـٰهَا مِن كُلِّ شَيْطَـٰنٍۢ رَّجِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	 kept	it	guarded	 from	every	
outcast	devil
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	usey		ham	ne	har	shaiṭān		se	mahfooz		
rakhā

arabicText: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱسْتَرَقَ ٱلسَّمْعَ فَأَتْبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Except	 one	 who	 comes	 to	 eavesdrop	 -
therefore	a	bright	flame	goes	after	him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	jo	chori	chupe	sunne	jāye	 to	us	ke	
peechhe		padtā	hai	roshan	sho’ala

arabicText: وَٱلْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَـٰهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَأَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ مَّوْزُونٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	spread	out	 the	earth,	and	placed	
mountains	as	anchors	in	it,	and	in	it	grew	
all	things	by	a	proper	measure.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 ham	 ne	 zamin	 phailāi	 aur	 is	 meiñ	
langar	dāle	aur	is	meiñ	har	chiz	andāze	se	
ugāi

arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَعَـٰيِشَ وَمَن لَّسْتُمْ لَهُۥ بِرَٰزِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	created	livelihoods	 for	 you	in	it,	and	
created	 those	 for	 whom	 you	 do	 not	
provide	the	sustenance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 tumhāre	liye	is	meiñ	 roziyāñ	 kar	 diñ	
aur	 woh	 kar	 diye	 jinheñ	 tum	 rizq	 nahiñ	
dete

arabicText: وَإِن مِّن شَىْءٍ إِلَّا عِندَنَا خَزَآئِنُهُۥ وَمَا نُنَزِّلُهُۥٓ إِلَّا بِقَدَرٍۢ مَّعْلُومٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	 there	is	not	a	 thing	 the	 treasure	*	of	
which	is	not	with	Us;	and	We	do	not	send	
it	down	except	by	a	known	measure.	(*	The	
power	to	create	it.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 koi	 chiz	 nahiñ	 jis	 ke	 hamāre	 pās	
khazāne	na	hoñ	aur	ham	usey		nahiñ	utārte	
magar	ek	m’aloom	andāze	se

arabicText: وَأَرْسَلْنَا ٱلرِّيَـٰحَ لَوَٰقِحَ فَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَأَسْقَيْنَـٰكُمُوهُ وَمَآ أَنتُمْ لَهُۥ بِخَـٰزِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 sent	 the	 winds	 that	 relieve	 the	
clouds’	burden,	therefore	caused	water	to	
descend	from	the	sky,	then	give	it	to	you	to	
drink;	and	you	are	not	at	all	its	treasurers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Ham	 ne	 hawāyeñ	 bhejiñ	 bādloñ	 ko	
bārwar	 karne	wāliyāñ	 to	 ham	 ne	āasmān		
se	 pāni	 utārā	 phir	 woh	 tumheñ	 pine	 ko	
diyā	aur	tum	kuchh		us	ke	khazānchi	nahiñ

arabicText: وَإِنَّا لَنَحْنُ نُحْىِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَنَحْنُ ٱلْوَٰرِثُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	it	is	We	Who	give	life	and	it	is	
We	 Who	 cause	 death,	 and	 We	 are	 the	
Inheritors
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 be-shak Ham	 hi	 jilāyeñ	 aur	 ham	 hi	
māreñ	aur	ham	hi	wāris	haiñ

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا ٱلْمُسْتَقْدِمِينَ مِنكُمْ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْنَا ٱلْمُسْتَـْٔخِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	it	is	We	Who	give	life	and	it	is	
We	 Who	 cause	 death,	 and	 We	 are	 the	
Inheritors
romanUrduTranslationText:
And	 indeed	 We	 know	 those	 among	 you	
who	 came	 forward	 and	indeed	We	 know	
those	among	you	who	remained	behind

arabicText: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ حَكِيمٌ عَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	your	Lord	only	will	raise	 them	all	
on	the	Day	of	Resurrection;	indeed	only	He	is	Wise,	All	Knowing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak Hameñ	m’aloom	haiñ	jo	 tum	
meiñ	 āage	 	 badhe	 aur	 be-shak	 	 hameñ	
m’aloom	haiñ	jo	tum	meiñ	peechhe		rahe

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن صَلْصَـٰلٍۢ مِّنْ حَمَإٍۢ مَّسْنُونٍۢ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	We	created	man	from	sounding	clay	made	out	of	black	smelly	mud.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 be-shak tumhārā	 Rab	 hi	 unheñ	
Qiyāmat	 meiñ	 uthāye	 gā	 be-shak	 	 wohi		
ìlm-o-hikmat	wālā	hai

arabicText: وَٱلْجَآنَّ خَلَقْنَـٰهُ مِن قَبْلُ مِن نَّارِ ٱلسَّمُومِ
englishTranslationText: And	created	the	jinn	before	him,	from	smokeless	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak		Ham	ne	āadmi	ko	bajti	hui	mitti	se	banāyā	jo	asl	meiñ	ek	siyāh	boo	dār	gārā	thi

arabicText: وَإِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ إِنِّى خَـٰلِقٌۢ بَشَرًۭا مِّن صَلْصَـٰلٍۢ مِّنْ حَمَإٍۢ مَّسْنُونٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	recall	when	your	Lord	said	to	the	angels,	“I	will	create	man	from	sounding	clay	made	out	of	
black	smelly	mud.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jinn	ko	is	se	pahle		banāyā	be	dhuyeñ	ki	āag	se

arabicText: فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُۥ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِى فَقَعُوا۟ لَهُۥ سَـٰجِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	when	I	have	properly	fashioned	him	and	breathed	into	him	a	chosen	noble	soul	from	
Myself,	fall	down	before	him	in	prostration.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yād	karo	jab	tumhāre	Rab	ne	firishtoñ	se	farmāyā	ke	maiñ	āadmi		ko	banāne	wālā	hooñ	bajti	
mitti	se	jo	badboo	dār	siyāh	gāre	se	hai.

arabicText: فَسَجَدَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ كُلُّهُمْ أَجْمَعُونَ
englishTranslationText: Therefore	all	the	angels,	each	and	every	one	of	them,	fell	prostrate
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	jab	maiñ	usey		thik	kar	looñ	aur	us	meiñ	apni	ṭaraf	ki	khās	mu’azzaz	rooh	phooñk	looñ	to	us	
ke	liye	sajde	meiñ	gir	padnā

arabicText: إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ مَعَ ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
englishTranslationText: Except	Iblis	(Satan);	he	refused	to	be	among	those	who	prostrated.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	jitne	firishte	they	sab	ke	sab	sajde	meiñ	gire

arabicText: إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ أَبَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ مَعَ ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
englishTranslationText: Except	Iblis	(Satan);	he	refused	to	be	among	those	who	prostrated.
romanUrduTranslationText: Siwā	iblis	ke	us	ne	sajde	wāloñ	kā	sāth	na	mānā

arabicText: قَالَ يَـٰٓإِبْلِيسُ مَا لَكَ أَلَّا تَكُونَ مَعَ ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Allah,	 “O	 Iblis!	What	 happened	 to	 you	
that	 you	 stayed	 apart	 from	 those	 who	
prostrated?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāyā	 aey	 iblis!	 Tujhe	 kyā	 huā	 ke	 sajdā	
karne	wāloñ	se	alag	rahā	?

arabicText: قَالَ لَمْ أَكُن لِّأَسْجُدَ لِبَشَرٍ خَلَقْتَهُۥ مِن صَلْصَـٰلٍۢ مِّنْ حَمَإٍۢ مَّسْنُونٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
He	 answered,	 “It	 does	 not	 befit	 me	 to	
prostrate	myself	to	a	human	whom	You	have	
created	 from	 sounding	 clay	 made	 out	 of	
black	smelly	mud.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bolā	mujhe	 zaibā	 nahiñ	 ke	 bashar	 ko	 sajdā	
karooñ	jise	tu	ne	bajti	mitti	se	banāyā	jo	siyāh	
boo	dār	gāre	se	thi

arabicText: قَالَ فَٱخْرُجْ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Allah,	“Therefore	exit	from	Paradise,	for	
you	are	an	outcast.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāyā	tu	Jannat	se	nikal	jā	ke	tu	mardood	
hai

arabicText: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ ٱللَّعْنَةَ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ
englishTranslationText:
“And	indeed	you	are	accursed	till	the	Day	of	
Judgement.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak		qiyāmat	tak	tujh	par	l’anat	hai

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِىٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	 “My	Lord!	Grant	me	respite	 till	 the	
day	when	they	will	all	be	raised.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bolā	 aey	mere	Rab!	 tu	mujhe	mohlat	 de	 us	
din	tak	ke	woh	uthāye	jāyeñ

arabicText: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُنظَرِينَ
englishTranslationText: Said	Allah,	“You	are	of	those	given	respite.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Farmāyā	tu	un	meiñ	hai	jin	ko

arabicText: إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْوَقْتِ ٱلْمَعْلُومِ
englishTranslationText: “Till	the	Day	of	a	well-known	time.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	m’aloom	waqt	ke	din	tak	mohlat	hai

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَآ أَغْوَيْتَنِى لَأُزَيِّنَنَّ لَهُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “My	 Lord!	 I	 swear	 by	 the	 fact	 that	
You	 sent	me	astray,	 I	 shall	distract	 them	in	
the	earth,	and	I	shall	lead	all	of	them	astray.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bolā	 aey	 Rab mere!	 Qasam	 us	 ki	 ke	 tu	 ne	
mujhe	gumrāh	kiyā	maiñ	unheñ	zamin	meiñ	
bhulāwe	dooñ	gā	aur	zaroor	maiñ	un	sab	ko	
be	rāh	kar	dooñ	gā

arabicText: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنْهُمُ ٱلْمُخْلَصِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Except	 those	 among	 them	 who	 are	 Your	
chosen	bondmen.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Magar	jo	un	meiñ	tere	chune	huye	bande	haiñ

arabicText: قَالَ هَـٰذَا صِرَٰطٌ عَلَىَّ مُسْتَقِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Allah,	“This	path*	leads	straight	towards	
Me.”	(* The path of the chosen bondmen.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Farmāyā	yeh	rāstā	sidhā	meri	ṭaraf	āatā		hai.

arabicText: إِنَّ عِبَادِى لَيْسَ لَكَ عَلَيْهِمْ سُلْطَـٰنٌ إِلَّا مَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْغَاوِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Indeed	you	do	not	have	any	power	over	My	
bondmen,	 except	 those	 wanderers	 who	
follow	 you.”	 ( The devil is unsuccessful in 
tempting Allah’s chosen bondmen to 
commit sin.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		mere	bandoñ	par	terā	kuchh		qāboo	
nahiñ	siwā	un	gumrāhoñ	ke	jo	terā	sāth	deñ

arabicText: وَإِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ لَمَوْعِدُهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	indeed	hell	is	the	promise	for	all	of	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak		Jahannam	un	sab	kā	w’adā	hai

arabicText: لَهَا سَبْعَةُ أَبْوَٰبٍۢ لِّكُلِّ بَابٍۢ مِّنْهُمْ جُزْءٌۭ مَّقْسُومٌ
englishTranslationText:
It	has	seven	gates;	for	each	gate	is	a	portion	
assigned	from	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Is	ke	sāt	darwāze	haiñ	har	darwāze	ke	liye	un	
meiñ	se	ek	hissā	batā	huā	hai

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍۢ وَعُيُونٍ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	the	pious	are	amidst	Gardens	and	springs.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		dar	wāle	bāghoñ	aur	chashmoñ	meiñ	haiñ

arabicText: ٱدْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَـٰمٍ ءَامِنِينَ
englishTranslationText: “Enter	them	with	peace,	in	safety.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	meiñ	dākhil	ho	salāmati	ke	sāth	amān	meiñ

arabicText: وَنَزَعْنَا مَا فِى صُدُورِهِم مِّنْ غِلٍّ إِخْوَٰنًا عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍۢ مُّتَقَـٰبِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	removed	any	resentments which	were	in	their	breasts	- they	are	brothers,	sitting	face	to	
face	on	thrones
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	un	ke	seenoñ	meiñ	jo	kuchh		keene	they	sab	khiñch	liye	āapas	meiñ	bhāi	haiñ	takhtoñ	par	
roo	ba-roo	baithe

arabicText: لَا يَمَسُّهُمْ فِيهَا نَصَبٌۭ وَمَا هُم مِّنْهَا بِمُخْرَجِينَ
englishTranslationText: Neither	any	hardship	is	to	reach	them	in	it,	nor	are	they	to	be	expelled	from	it
romanUrduTranslationText: Na	unheñ	us	meiñ	kuchh		taklif	pahuñche	na	woh	us	meiñ	se	nikāle	jāyeñ

arabicText: ۞ نَبِّئْ عِبَادِىٓ أَنِّىٓ أَنَا ٱلْغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
englishTranslationText: Inform	My	bondmen	that	undoubtedly,	I	surely	am	the	Oft-Forgiving,	the	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText: Khabar	do	mere	bandoñ	ko	ke	be-shak		maiñ	hi	hooñ	bakhsh	ne	wālā	meherbān

arabicText: وَأَنَّ عَذَابِى هُوَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ٱلْأَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText: And that	indeed	the	punishment	of	Mine	is	a	painful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	merā	hi	‘aƶāb	dard-nāk	‘aƶāb	hai

arabicText: وَأَنَّ عَذَابِى هُوَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ٱلْأَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText: And that	indeed	the	punishment	of	Mine	is	a	painful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	merā	hi	‘aƶāb	dard-nāk	‘aƶāb	hai

arabicText: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ عَن ضَيْفِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ
englishTranslationText: And	inform	them	of	Ibrahim’s	guests
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	unheñ	ahwāl	sunāo	Ibrāhim ke	mehmānoñ	kā

arabicText: إِذْ دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا۟ سَلَـٰمًۭا قَالَ إِنَّا مِنكُمْ وَجِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
When	 the	 angels	 came	 to	 him	 and	 said,	
“Peace";	he	said,	“We	feel	afraid	of	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	woh	us	ke	pās	āaye		to	bole	Salām kahā	
hameñ	tum	se	dar	m’aloom	hotā	hai

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ لَا تَوْجَلْ إِنَّا نُبَشِّرُكَ بِغُلَـٰمٍ عَلِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Do	not	fear	- we	convey	to	you	
the	glad	tidings	of	a	knowledgeable	boy.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unhoñ	ne	kahā	dariye	nahiñ	ham	āap		ko	
ek	ìlm	wāle	ladke	ki	bashārat	dete	haiñ

arabicText: قَالَ أَبَشَّرْتُمُونِى عَلَىٰٓ أَن مَّسَّنِىَ ٱلْكِبَرُ فَبِمَ تُبَشِّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Do	not	fear	- we	convey	to	you	
the	glad	tidings	of	a	knowledgeable	boy.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	kyā	is	par	mujhe	bashārat	dete	ho	ke	
mujhe	budāpā	pahuñch	gayā	ab	 kāhe	par	
bashārat	dete	ho?

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ بَشَّرْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ فَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْقَـٰنِطِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Do	not	fear	- we	convey	to	you	
the	glad	tidings	of	a	knowledgeable	boy.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
They	said,	“We	have	given	you	true	tidings,	
therefore	do	not	lose	hope.”

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ بَشَّرْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ فَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْقَـٰنِطِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“We	have	given	you	true	tidings,	
therefore	do	not	lose	hope.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	ham	ne	āap ko	sachchi	bashārat	di	hai	
āap		nā	ummid	na	hoñ

arabicText: قَالَ وَمَن يَقْنَطُ مِن رَّحْمَةِ رَبِّهِۦٓ إِلَّا ٱلضَّآلُّونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“Who	is	it	that	despairs	 from	the	
mercy	 of	 his	 Lord,	 except	 those	 who	 are	
astray?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā apne	 Rab	 ki	 rahmat	 	 se	 kaun	 nā	
ummid	ho	magar	wohi		jo	gumrāh	huye

arabicText: قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“And	what	is	your	next	task,	O	the	
sent	angels?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	 phir	 tumhārā	 kyā	 kām	 hai	 aey	
firishto!

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّآ أُرْسِلْنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍۢ مُّجْرِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	 “We	have	been	sent	 towards	a	
guilty	nation.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	 ham	 ek	mujrim	 qaum	 ki	ṭaraf	 bheje	
gaye	haiñ

arabicText: إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٍ إِنَّا لَمُنَجُّوهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Except	the	 family	of	Lut;	we	shall	rescue	
all	of	them.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	 Lūṭ ke	 ghar	 wāle	 un	 sab	 ko	 ham	
bachā	leñ	ge

arabicText: إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَهُۥ قَدَّرْنَآ ۙ إِنَّهَا لَمِنَ ٱلْغَـٰبِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Except	his	wife	- we	have	decided	that	she	
is	of	those	who	will	stay	behind.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	us	ki	‘aurat	ham	thahrā	chuke	haiñ	
ke	woh	peechhe	rah	jāne	wāloñ	meiñ	hai

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ءَالَ لُوطٍ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 the	 sent	 angels	 came	 to	 the	
house	of	Lut.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	jab	Looṭ		ke	ghar	firishte	āaye

arabicText: قَالَ إِنَّكُمْ قَوْمٌۭ مُّنكَرُونَ
englishTranslationText: He	said,	“You	are	an	unfamiliar	people.”
romanUrduTranslationText: kahā	tum	to	kuchh		begāna	log	ho

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ جِئْنَـٰكَ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ فِيهِ يَمْتَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	 “In	 fact	we	have	brought	 to	 you	
the	matter	which	these	people	doubted.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Kahā	balke	ham	to	āap ke	pās	woh	lāye	haiñ	jis	meiñ	yeh	log	shak	karte	they

arabicText: وَأَتَيْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَإِنَّا لَصَـٰدِقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	 we	 have	 brought	 to	 you	 a	 true	
command,	and	indeed	we	are	truthful.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ham	āap ke	pās	sachchā	hukm	lāye	haiñ	aur	ham	be-shak		sachche	haiñ

arabicText: فَأَسْرِ بِأَهْلِكَ بِقِطْعٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ وَٱتَّبِعْ أَدْبَـٰرَهُمْ وَلَا يَلْتَفِتْ مِنكُمْ أَحَدٌۭ وَٱمْضُوا۟ حَيْثُ تُؤْمَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Therefore	 journey	 with	 your	 household	
while	a	portion	of	 the	night	remains,	and	
you	tread	behind	them	- and	none	of	you	may	turn	around	and	see,	and	proceed	directly	to	the	
place	you	are	commanded	to.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	apne	ghar	wāloñ	ko	kuchh		rāt	rahe	le	kar	bāhar	jāiye	aur	āap		un	ke	peechhe chaliye	aur	tum	
meiñ	koi	peechhe		phir	kar	na	dekhe	aur	jahāñ	ko	hukm	hai	sidhe	chale	jāiye

arabicText: وَقَضَيْنَآ إِلَيْهِ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْأَمْرَ أَنَّ دَابِرَ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ مَقْطُوعٌۭ مُّصْبِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	informed	him	the	decision	of	this	command,	that	at	morning	the	root	of	the	disbelievers	
would	be	cut	off.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ham	ne	usey us	hukm	kā	faislā	sunā	diyā	ke	subah	hote	in	kāfiroñ	ki	jad	kat	jāye	gi

arabicText: وَجَآءَ أَهْلُ ٱلْمَدِينَةِ يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	the	people	of	the	city	came	rejoicing.	(*	To	the	house	of	Prophet	Lut.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	shaher	wāle	khushiyāñ	manāte	āaye

arabicText: قَالَ إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ضَيْفِى فَلَا تَفْضَحُونِ
englishTranslationText: He	said,	“These	are	my	guests	- do	not	dishonour	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Lūṭ ne	kahā	yeh	mere	mehmān	haiñ	mujhe	fazihat	na	karo

arabicText: وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَلَا تُخْزُونِ
englishTranslationText: “And	fear	Allah and	do	not	disgrace	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Allāh	se	daro	aur	mujhe	ruswā	na	karo

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ أَوَلَمْ نَنْهَكَ عَنِ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText: They	said,	“Had	we	not	forbidden	you	from	meddling	in	the	affairs	of	anyone?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bole	kyā	ham	ne	tumheñ	man’a	na	kiyā	thā	ke	aoroñ	ke	mu’āmle	meiñ	dakhal	na	do?

arabicText: قَالَ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ بَنَاتِىٓ إِن كُنتُمْ فَـٰعِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“These	women	of	our	tribe	are	my	
daughters,	if	you	have	to.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	 yeh	 qaum	 ki	 ‘aurateñ	 meri	 betiyāñ	
haiñ	agar	tumheñ	karnā	hai

arabicText: لَعَمْرُكَ إِنَّهُمْ لَفِى سَكْرَتِهِمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
englishTranslationText:
By	your	life	O	dear	Prophet	(Muhammad	-
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	- they	are	
indeed	straying	in	their	intoxication.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 Mehboob!	 Tumhāri	 jān	 ki	 qasam	 beshak woh	 apne	 nashe	 meiñ	 bhatak	 rahe	
haiñ.

arabicText: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلصَّيْحَةُ مُشْرِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	 the	 scream	 overcame	 them	 at	
sunrise.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	din	nikalte	unheñ	chinghād	ne	āaliya

arabicText: فَجَعَلْنَا عَـٰلِيَهَا سَافِلَهَا وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةًۭ مِّن سِجِّيلٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	turned the	township	upside	down	
and	 rained	 upon	 them	 stones	 of	 heated	
clay.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	ham	ne	us	basti	kā	ūpar	kā	hissā	us	ke	
neeche	kā	hissā	kar	diyā	aur	un	par	kankar	
ke	paththar	barsāye
